World’s Third-Largest Mosque – Let’s give privilege to boom religion along with Islamic architecture.

Tremendously booming Islamic architecture in the world, the Grand Jamia Mosque Karachi is the world’s third-largest mosque. The mosque is also known as Bahria Town Jamia Masjid Complex, situated in the southern port city; Karachi. The mosque is an exclusive specimen of Islamic architecture and cultural complex which is currently under construction in Bahria Town Karachi, Pakistan. However, it is anticipated that the mosque would be avowed the world’s third-largest mosque having a capacity to accommodate 800,000 worshippers at a one time. The construction of the edifice of Grand Jamia Mosque was commenced in 2015. Thousands of engineers, masons, and laborers are working day and night to complete its structure. Howbeit, the structure of the mosque is 50-60% completed so the grand structure is evident from miles away.

Mammoth Venture of Architecture

This monumental work of Pakistan is being sponsored by the Bahria Town, one of Pakistan’s largest real estate developers, that is, property mogul Malik Riaz’s venture. Before this majestic mosque, Malik Riaz has accredited to superciliously present the world’s seven-largest mosque named Grand Jamia Masjid which is situated in Bahria Town Lahore. The world’s seven-largest mosque can accommodate 70,000 worshippers at one time. The construction of this mosque was completed in 2014. The estimated construction cost of this iconic mosque was 4 billion. Blissfully, the Grand Jamia Masjid Lahore was also entitled as Pakistan’s largest mosque, before the commencement of the Grand Jamia Mosque Karachi’s construction.

 Minutiae of the Grand Jamia Mosque

The world’s third-largest Mosque has exclusive minutiae as the architecture of the mosque is mingling of Mughal, Persian, Chinese and Turkish architecture. Howbeit, the architecture of the mosque is of great significance since it’s the hodgepodge of distinct architectural blueprints. This exclusive fusion amplifies the grandeur of the mosque and nominates it as a crowning achievement. The Grand Jamia Mosque covers an area of 50 acres at the top of a 60 ft (18 m) high. The site of the mosque is fundamentally worthy of making it palpable from miles away. Likewise, the design of the mosque is an absolute chef-d’oeuvre in the domain of architecture that includes a 325 ft (99 m) long minaret. Additionally, it has 150 feet high steel structured dome; the tallest Dome in Pakistan. The interior of the mosque is also worth-appreciated as the Kofi Calligraphy is used for the décor of the mosques, embellished with Sindhi styled woodwork and Glass art.

Rudiments of the Grand Jamia Mosque, third-largest mosque Karachi

The iconic building of the mosque has a magnificent look due to the fusion of the world’s great architectural styles. Also, having an amalgamation of Mughal and European architectural styles, the mosque has a spell-binding look and design. The rudiments of the grand Jamia mosque include an international state of the art air-conditioning university, along with an Islamic cultural center, museum, and a research center. The Grand Jamia Mosque has five colossal and Mughal chic entrances leaving a majestic impact on the worshippers. Among many particulars, the mosque is predominately venerable for having a separate basement that will be solely dedicated to females to offer their prayers. The majestic mosque has 150 domes and 12 implausible types of Natural Stones and titles are being used, and are originally fetched from Lasbella, Baluchistan. Thence, the Grand Jamia Mosque is rapidly completing its various stages of development and it is predominately going to be an accurate tiara jewel of not only Bahria Town Karachi but entire Pakistan.

Majesty of the Grand Jamia Mosque, Karachi 

The majesty of the Grand Jamia Mosque is evident from its structure, design, site, area, and fusion of the world’s tremendous architecture styles. It is believed that the mosque is majestically going to be the world’s Third Largest Mosque, surrounded by hefty gardens which are fenced by arch-shaped walls on all four sides. Subsequent to the Masjid-al-Haram (Grand Mosque) in Makkah and Masjid-e-Nabvi (Prophet’s Mosque) in Medina; the two biggest Mosques in the world, the grand Jamia Mosque is going to be the third-largest mosque in the world paving a way of victory. However, there is no ambiguity in the fact that there can be no Mosque more divine than the former two mosques respecting their sacredness. But the splendor of the fact is that the Grand Jamia Mosque Karachi is pompously subsequent to the world’s most sacred and sanctified places. Thence, it is a great honor and privilege for the architecture of our country.
